title: YouTube tests restricting ad blocker users to 3 video views
description: YouTube is currently running what it describes as a "small experiment globally," warning users to toggle off their ad blockers and avoid being limited to only three video views. [...]

title: New EarlyRAT malware linked to North Korean Andariel hacking group
description: Security analysts have discovered a previously undocumented remote access trojan (RAT) named 'EarlyRAT,' used by Andariel, a sub-group of the Lazarus North Korean state-sponsored hacking group. [...]

title: Microsoft rolls out early Windows Copilot preview to Insiders
description: Microsoft announced today that an early preview of its AI-powered Windows Copilot personal assistant is rolling out to Insiders in the Windows 11 Dev Channel. [...]

title: MITRE releases new list of top 25 most dangerous software bugs
description: MITRE shared today this year's list of the top 25 most dangerous weaknesses plaguing software during the previous two years. [...]

title: Pro-Russia DDoSia hacktivist project sees 2,400% membership increase
description: The pro-Russia crowdsourced DDoS (distributed denial of service) project, 'DDoSia,' has seen a massive 2,400% growth in less than a year, with over ten thousand people helping conduct attacks on Western organizations. [...]

title: Proton launches open-source password manager with some limitations
description: Proton AG has announced the global availability of Proton Pass, an open-source and free-to-use password manager available as a browser extension or mobile app on Android and iOS.manager. [...]

title: Criminal IP Unveils Bug Bounty Program to Boost User Safety, Security
description: OSINT-based CTI search engine Criminal IP has launched a bug bounty program aimed at strengthening the safety of its services and protecting its users. [...]

title: Microsoft fixes bug that breaks Windows Start Menu, UWP apps
description: Microsoft has addressed a bug causing Windows Search and the Start Menu to become unresponsive and some Windows applications to no longer open. [...]

title: Trellix fixes bug breaking Office apps after June Windows updates
description: Cybersecurity firm Trellix has addressed an incompatibility issue causing Endpoint Security Agent's Exploit Guard module to block some Microsoft Office and third-party apps from opening after installing June 2023 cumulative updates. [...]
